column4: I was already running 9.10 The system said there were 9 packages to be updated so I said "apt-get upgrade"
reboot did nothing
halt did nothing
shutdown did nothing.
Alt-Ctrl-Del did nothing
shutdown -r now
It just returns back to the "#" prompt
Where does bootlogd keep its log
I'm totally not happy with uuntu right now.
Ubuntu keeps insisting I upgrade packages and I'm like "Sure ok, this is ubunto not Gentoo, ubuntu would never screw me over for just applying upgrades."
Even on LTS, upgrades sometimes mess things up. :(
Never happend to me before except on gentoo. And even on gentoo it was something dumb like SSH broke so you could still recover from the localconsole. This is like "Poof your can't boot anymore".
When "can't boot anymore" stuff happens to me with ubuntu it's usually X server settings involving DRI/GL.
(not saying it is for you, just that that sort of thing seems to happen to me a lot)
Thats another thing I boot into console to avoid any damage like that but now its like I can't even get that far
Ouch. Can it boot single-user?
reinstall grub boo loader woulden't help me right since well a kernel came up already.

Nope this problem happens before even that as it hangs right after fsck supposedly give the file system a clean bill of health. It feels more like this problem is during the ramdisk chroot to the root file system.
Or something like the root file system isn't being mounted or mounted read only or something stupid like that.
Could it possibly be something related to bug 447747 ?
I had a "can't boot" problem because of that, https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/447747
